title: SP MLA Abu Asim Azmi appears before Mumbai Police over Aurangzeb remark
content: The controversy erupted after Abu Asim Azmi made remarks about Aurangzeb within the premises of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly last week

title: CM Yogi Adityanath calls for 'permanent action' against loudspeakers at religious places
content: The CM instructed officials to install CCTV cameras at key locations, such as banks, financial institutions, shops, and commercial establishments

title: WFI suspension revoked: Vinesh Phogat expresses dismay
content: I say this with sadness that for two years we struggled in the streets... we were fighting to save the sport of wrestling. And now, two days ago, your party (BJP) has given the sport in his hands again, says Vinesh Phogat

title: Seven killed; three injured as gas tanker hits 2 vehicles in Madhya Pradesh’s Dhar
content: Local residents helped in the operation during which trapped persons were pulled out of the vehicles using a crane

title: Farmers march to Mumbai, demand scrapping of Shaktipeeth project
content: The proposed Nagpur to Goa Shaktipeeth Expressway project, approved in 2023, has created a stir among the farmers across the State as the project entails acquiring land from farmers in several districts passing between Nagpur and Goa

title: Maharashtra government to conduct MPSC exams in Marathi
content: With this decision, engineering course books will now be available in Marathi. Consequently, the government has planned to prepare the syllabus for engineering examinations in Marathi and conduct competitive exams for all technical posts in the language, says CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: Pune bus rape: Court remands accused Dattatray Gade to judicial custody until March 26
content: Accused Dattatray Gade was arrested on February 28, 2025, for allegedly raping a 26-year-old woman inside a parked Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation bus at Swargate bus depot in Pune in the early hours of February 25, 2025.

title: How India views Russia and the Ukraine war
content: Findings underscore the complexity of Indian perspectives on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, revealing that socio-economic and cultural factors significantly influence public opinion

title: Is the government stifling the online gaming sector? | Explained
content: Online skill-based gaming has the potential to harness programming, design, and storytelling talent to leapfrog India to the top of the tech leader board globally

title: Why do Indians perceive Europe as a land of better job opportunities?
content: The perception of Europe as a land of better job opportunities is driven by multiple factors, including higher wages, structured career growth, financial incentives, and lifestyle advantages

title: The foreign dream: aspirations and perceptions of traveling abroad
content: The U.K., Germany, and France are considered particularly hospitable for education, employment, and tourism, further enhancing their appeal among Indian travellers

title: Sagar to Mahasagar: India upgrades Mauritius ties
content: India and Mauritius have upgraded their relationship to an Enhanced Strategic Partnership. Prime Minister Modi emphasized cooperation in defense, maritime security, trade, and development. India will support Mauritius with a new Parliament building and a rupee-denominated line of credit for water pipeline replacement. Both countries reaffirmed commitment to a secure and open Indian Ocean.

title: 'Damage to trees': WB govt imposes ban on Holi celebrations in Santiniketan
content: The West Bengal government has banned Holi celebrations at Sonajhuri Haat in Santiniketan due to concerns over potential damage to the area's greenery. Authorities have placed banners advising visitors not to park vehicles or celebrate Holi there, citing its proximity to Visva Bharati University, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

title: Pakistan train attack: Why is there an increase in attacks in Balochistan?
content: Balochistan's long-standing insurgency reached a new level, with the Baluch Liberation Army seizing a passenger train. The militants killed 21 passengers before being overpowered by Pakistani forces. The BLA fights for independence and more control over Balochistan's resources, claiming support from India. This attack might weaken their support despite drawing significant attention.

title: '99.9% of people are happy': Brij Bhushan on WFI ban lift
content: The Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports restored the Wrestling Federation of India's recognition, lifting its suspension. Former WFI President, Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh shared his views on the decision. The suspension was initially imposed due to procedural lapses and accusations of sexual harassment against Singh, but has now been lifted to benefit the sport and its athletes.

title: UP man gives Rs 50,000 to ‘gau rakshak’ to frame rival in cow slaughter case
content: A 'gau rakshak' named Vish Singh Kamboj was arrested in Saharanpur for fabricating a cow slaughter case to frame a rival meat trader. His actions included placing old bovine remains on a highway to demand police action. Another trader, Tipu Qureshi, allegedly paid Kamboj to target his more successful business partner. Qureshi is currently at large.

title: Elon Musk makes another ‘catastrophic population collapse’ warning, this time for …
content: Elon Musk has expressed concern about South Korea's declining population, highlighting the country's low fertility rate of 0.68. He warned of a 'catastrophic population collapse' and stated that immigration is not a sustainable solution.

title: Former Aus cricketer MacGill found guilty in cocaine deal
content: A Sydney District Court jury acquitted former Australia Test cricketer Stuart MacGill of involvement in a significant commercial drug deal but convicted him on a lesser charge tied to drug supply. Despite arranging a meeting, MacGill claimed he was unaware of the cocaine transaction arranged by his supplier and brother-in-law.

title: 'What's new?': Bhupinder Hooda plays down BJP’s victory in local elections
content: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda downplayed BJP's victory in the municipal elections, noting that the party has won before. Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini commended local body's role in achieving PM Modi's vision. BJP secured nine mayoral posts, except in Manesar. In Faridabad, Mayor-elect Parveen Joshi pledged to address local issues.

title: Holika Dahan 2025: Your guide to shubh muhurat, pooja vidhi and mantras
content: Holika Dahan, a significant Hindu festival, will be observed on March 13, 2025. The festival symbolizes the triumph of good over evil and includes specific rituals. The auspicious time for the rituals begins after Bhadra Kaal and continues into Pradosh Kaal. Essential materials and mantras are also suggested for a spiritually fulfilling celebration.

title: Nithin Kamath says Zerodha user numbers down for first time in 15 years
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath revealed that the company is experiencing its first business slowdown in 15 years. A decline in active users across major stock broking platforms signifies a broader market correction. According to National Stock Exchange (NSE) data, eight of the top 10 broking firms saw a decline in active investors in February.  Kamath noted a 30% drop in trading activity due to market conditions and regulatory changes.

title: 'What’s with these socks': Trump teases JD Vance in Oval Office; watch video
content: During the annual St. Patrick's Day celebration at the White House, President Trump praised Vice President JD Vance's shamrock-themed socks, creating a lighthearted moment that amused attendees. The conversation, which initially focused on inflation, shifted to Vance's festive accessories, garnering laughter and attention.

title: ‘No need for moon mission, Isro': Bengaluru residents on crater-riddled roads
content: Hundreds of frustrated residents in Bellandur protested against the poor condition of their crater-filled roads, urging the government for quick repairs. With no pavements and terrible road conditions, even short drives have become arduous, significantly impacting the daily lives and safety of the residents.

title: The Balochistan Story: Jinnah Betrayal, Armed Rebellion, Bangladesh Impact
content: Balochistan, the largest and the most sparsely populated province of Pakistan, had always harboured dreams of being independent.

title: Trump Warns Putin: Refusing Ceasefire "Would Be Devastating For Russia"
content: Donald Trump said that US negotiators are headed to Russia "right now" for talks on a possible ceasefire with Ukraine, a day after Kyiv agreed to a 30-day truce.

title: NASA-SpaceX Postpone Mission To Bring Back Stranded Astronauts
content: According to NASA and SpaceX, they have scrubbed today's launch attempt of the agency's Crew-10 mission to the International Space Station due to a hydraulic system issue.

title: "Hostages Used As Human Shields": Pakistan Train Siege Ends After 30 Hours
content: The Jaffar Express, carrying 440 passengers, was hijacked by Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) members when it was going from Quetta to Peshawar.

title: Russia Presents List Of Demands For Talks With US On Ukraine Deal: Report
content: It is not clear what exactly Moscow included on its list or whether it is willing to engage in peace talks with Kyiv prior to their acceptance.

title: How Actor Ranya Rao Managed To Give Airport Security The Slip
content: Actor Ranya Rao's gold smuggling racket involved a huge syndicate and she got through airports with the help of the State Protocol Officer who was also part of the racket, the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence or DRI.

title: IndusInd Bank's Damage Control After Rs 2,100 Crore Accounting Lapse
content: IndusInd Bank on Tuesday addressed the fallout of a Rs 2,100 crore discrepancy in accounting, saying it has enough reserves and capital to cover for it.

title: "Why Should I Speak Marathi?" Airtel Employee's Video Goes Viral, Sparks Row
content: BJP MLC Chitra Wagh called for promoting the use of local language in Maharashtra, a statement which comes after a video of a female employee of a prominent telecom company purportedly refusing to interact with a customer in Marathi went viral.

title: "8 Urns With Bones, Hair": A 'Black Magic' Twist In Lilavati Hospital Fraud
content: The trustees of Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital have made shocking allegations of black magic as the premier healthcare facility made headlines due to a huge misappropriation of funds

title: Loudspeakers At Religious Sites: Yogi Adityanath Calls For Permanent Action
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday called for permanent noise control measures for loudspeakers mounted at religious places.

title: "ICC Showed The Mirror, Pakistan Doesn't Deserve To Be At CT Presentation"
content: Kamran Akmal addressed the recent controversy surrounding the absence of a representative from host nation Pakistan during the prize distribution ceremony of the recently concluded Champions Trophy

title: Hundreds of hotels, but never 100% occupancy in Majestic
content: As the Karnataka Budget for 2025-26 announced plans for the redevelopment of the Kempegowda Bus Station at Majestic, The Hindu, in a six-part series, will explore the various facets of the pete area. This is the fourth story in the series.

title: QS subject-wise rankings: ISM Dhanbad, IIT Delhi among 9 Indian institutions in world’s top 50
content: The Indian School of Mines, Dhanbad, ranks 20th globally for Engineering-Mineral and Mining and making it the country’s highest-performing subject area

title: Licensing system and safety overhaul proposed for hostels
content: Enhancing hostel safety in Cyberabad through licensing, fire safety compliance, and a detailed information platform for residents and employees

title: Former DRDO chief Satheesh Reddy to inaugurate Gora Techno Hub on March 13
content: G. Satheesh Reddy to inaugurate Gora Techno Hub in Vijayawada, promoting STEM education and scientific advancements for children

title: Kadambari case: govt. extends suspension of three IPS officers
content: State government extends suspension of three IPS officers, appoints new Chief Vigilance & Security Officer for Tirumala Tirupati Devastanams

title: Chhattisgarh Government approves new rehabilitation policy for surrendered Maoists
content: Chhattisgarh government approves new rehabilitation policy for surrendered Maoists, aims to promote peace, development, and good governance

title: Congress, DMK MPs walk out of Lok Sabha over nod given to energy project along Pakistan border
content: Outside Parliament, the Congress rakes up the Adani Group’s alleged links with Mauritius-based shell companies; Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a visit to the island nation.

title: Resolving the vexatious fishing dispute
content: Talks between the fishermen of India and Sri Lanka could pave the way for an agreement to put an end to bottom trawling

title: Vengaivayal case hearing postponed to March 20
content: The CB-CID police, investigating the case, filed a chargesheet against police constable Muraliraja, Muthukrishnan, and Sudarshan, all residents of the same locality, for their alleged involvement.

title: New eel species discovered off Thoothukudi coast named after Tamil
content: Fishermen who helped the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources in identifying the species wanted it named after Tamil Nadu

title: NASA astronaut Butch Wilmore's daughter shares why she's missing him more than ever now
content: NASA astronaut Butch Wilmore's daughter shared a poignant video revealing his missed moments due to his extended space mission. Wilmore and Sunita Williams are expected to return from the ISS by March 16, 2025, after a rescheduled launch. The family has been waiting since June, marking significant life events in his absence, including a wedding anniversary.

title: Mark Zuckerberg visits White House for second meeting with Donald Trump
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg visited the White House to discuss American technology leadership with Trump administration officials. The visit followed Meta's recent advancements in AI and ongoing development of its first internally designed chip, in collaboration with TSMC.

title: 'Pakistan is its worst enemy': Arthur backs Gillespie after ‘clown’ jab
content: Pakistan cricket is facing turmoil after an early exit from the Champions Trophy 2025. Mickey Arthur criticises the instability despite talented players and quality coaches like Jason Gillespie and Gary Kirsten. Internal conflicts and media agendas are blamed for undermining efforts. Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan have been dropped for the upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens in green; Nifty50 near 22,500
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While BSE Sensex was above 74,100, Nifty50 was near 22,500.

title: UP horror: Dressed as woman, man enters lover's house, sets her on fire
content: In Mathura, a 28-year-old man disguised as a woman entered his lover's home and set her on fire after she refused to elope with him. Rekha Kumari, 30, sustained 70% burn injuries. The accused, Umesh Singh, was a frequent visitor and had a previous relationship with Rekha. A case has been registered, and he is currently undergoing treatment.

title: 4 dead as speeding Mercedes wreaks havoc on Dehradun road, driver flees
content: A speeding Mercedes with a Chandigarh registration number killed four people and critically injured two others near Sai Baba Temple on Rajpur Road in Dehradun. The driver fled the scene. Authorities are working to identify the driver and have linked 11-12 vehicles to the case.

title: Viral video: Dhoni, Pant sing their hearts out to 'Tu Jaane Na'
content: A video of MS Dhoni and Rishabh Pant singing 'Tu Jaane Na' at Sakshi Pant's sangeet has gone viral. The ceremony, held in Dehradun, featured several cricket stars. Dhoni attended with his wife Sakshi, and Pant joined fresh from winning the Champions Trophy. More cricketers like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are expected at the wedding.

title: Rajan Shahi talks about managing Hina Khan's spa, waxing and other expenses
content: Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai has aired for over 15 years, starring Hina Khan and Karan Mehra as iconic characters Akshara and Naitik. Producer Rajan Shahi shared insights on preparing Hina for the role, involving extensive efforts and overcoming channel disapprovals. Despite past conflicts, Hina still acknowledges his support. The duo's storyline remains beloved.

title: Manipur talks stuck as Kukis insist on ‘separate hill state’
content: Following the return of a killed youth's body to his family in Manipur's Kangpokpi, authorities anticipate an end to protests and blockades in the district. However, tensions persist as the Kuki-Zo community demands a separate hill state, conflicting with the Constitutional framework. Efforts are ongoing to engage with both Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities for a resolution within Constitutional bounds.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for March 13
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha of Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends buying DLF, SRF, and Adani Ports. Nifty is poised for an upward journey towards 22800+, while Bank Nifty faces bearish pressures.

title: Holi and Holika Dahan 2025: Correct date, muhurat timings, rituals, significance, and all one needs to know
content: Holi 2025 celebrations will occur on March 13th and 14th, starting with Holika Dahan and followed by Rangwali Holi. Holika Dahan symbolizes the victory of good over evil, with rituals carried out around a bonfire. It's advised to use organic colors and play Holi consensually.

title: 'It's up to Russia now': US team headed to Moscow for Ukraine ceasefire talks
content: US President Donald Trump announced that high-level negotiators are headed to Russia to discuss a ceasefire in Ukraine following Kyiv's agreement to a US-backed 30-day truce. Trump emphasized diplomacy but warned of possible sanctions if Russia does not cooperate.

title: Tiny cut, but Ladli gets lion’s share of MP budget
content: Madhya Pradesh's 2025-26 budget sees a 15% increase over the previous year, reaching Rs 4,21,032 crore. Despite no new taxes, several key schemes face cuts, including Ladli Behna Yojana. Major cuts are also seen in allocations for primary and secondary schools, and PM Gram Sadak Yojana.

title: Former NBA center and Arkansas Razorbacks legend Oliver Miller passes away at 54
content: Oliver Miller, a former NBA center and Arkansas Razorbacks legend, passed away at 54. Known as 'The Big O,' he was vital in Arkansas' 1990 Final Four run and enjoyed a nine-year NBA career. His contributions were acknowledged by former teams and fans alike.

title: 50 Years Later, US Murder Mystery Solved Through Old Tape And Photo
content: The cold case, which involved Sturtz's strangulation after meeting her attacker at a bar on August 24, 1975, remained a mystery for decades.

title: "Get In, Patriots": Donald Trump Buys Tesla, Elon Musk Helps Him Pick
content: Donald Trump bought the Tesla in a show of support for Elon Musk's electric vehicle company, which is facing a blowback because of the Tesla CEO's work to advance the President's political agenda.

title: ICC Sends Big Message To PCB Amid Champions Trophy 2025 Ceremony Row
content: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has thanked the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) for successfully hosting the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: RSS-BJP workers illegally detain Tushar Gandhi
content: Protesters were reportedly irked by Tushar Gandhi terming the RSS a cancer on the nation’s soul in a speech commemorating the 100th anniversary of Sree Narayana Guru’s historic meeting with Mahatma Gandhi

title: Snake-bitten patients get a new lease of life at Kozhikode MCH
content: Seven patients each recovered in Jan. and Feb.; experts highlight the need for swift medical attention and awareness of venomous species

title: Bhatti to present Budget on March 19
content: State Budget to be presented in Legislative Assembly on March 19, with sessions continuing till March 27 Business Advisory Committee finalises agenda

title: Telangana government forms Future City Development Authority; Hyderabad Metropolitan region expanded
content: FCDA will have in its jurisdiction over 765.28 square kilometres encompassing 56 revenue villages from seven mandals of  Ranga Reddy district, while  HMDA’s purview has been expanded to cover 10,472.723 square kilometres

title: Lok Sabha passes Oilfields Amendment Bill
content: The Bill seeks to amend the existing law governing exploration and production of oil and gas as well as delink petroleum operations from mining operations

title: No road to tribal hamlet in Anakapalli district forces residents to carry new mother to hospital in ‘doli’
content: Sanctioned in 2023, road project was delayed due to a lack of clearance from the Forest Department and enforcement of the model code of conduct for MLA and MLC polls

title: Immigration and Foreigners Bill not connected to grant of citizenship, says official
content: The Bill is a comprehensive legislation to regulate all matters relating to foreigners and immigration that are currently administered through four Acts, which are proposed to be repealed

title: Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore likely to have 'baby feet' after arrival on earth
content: Astronauts returning from space experience 'baby feet,' where their soles become hypersensitive due to microgravity. This is caused by the lack of weight-bearing exercises. Recovery involves gradual re-acclimatization to pressure, specific exercises, balance training, and proper hydration. Other effects include puffy faces, muscle loss, and dizziness. Rehabilitation is critical for a complete recovery.

title: Ragini Khanna recalls quitting The Kapil Sharma Show because she didn't want to play the 'hot girl'
content: Ragini Khanna discussed why she left The Kapil Sharma Show. She stated that the show offered nothing fresh and only gave her roles where women wore revealing clothes. This objectification made her uncomfortable. She also mentioned that long working hours on TV affected her health, giving her severe gastroenteritis.

title: When Kohli, Gill and others brought Holi vibe with THIS Amitabh song
content: Cricketer Shubman Gill shared a 2023 video showcasing Team India, including Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, celebrating Holi on a bus before their fourth Test against Australia. The celebration featured Amitabh Bachchan's iconic Holi song 'Rang Barse Bhige Chunar Wali' from the movie 'Silsila,' which added to the festive spirit as the team danced and cheered.

title: “Hardest record to break”: Wayne Gretzky reveals his favorite all-time NHL record
content: Wayne Gretzky, an iconic NHL player who retired in 1999 with 61 NHL records, discussed his favorite record with comedian Theo Von. Gretzky cherished his achievement of scoring 50 goals in 39 games during the 1981-82 season, a record he considers almost unbreakable. His impressive career set new benchmarks in ice hockey history.

title: Musk, Mittal, now Mukesh: Jio too unveils Starlink deal
content: Airtel and Reliance Jio have announced deals to market Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet in India, pending regulatory approvals. These partnerships aim to enhance network coverage, especially in rural and remote areas where connectivity is limited. Satellite internet services will, however, be more expensive and initially cater to enterprise sectors.

title: Choti Holi 2025: Wishes, quotes & status
content: Choti Holi, or Holika Dahan, celebrates the triumph of good over evil and precedes the Holi festival. It involves lighting bonfires, performing rituals, and sharing wishes. The festival symbolizes the victory of righteousness through the legend of Prahlad and Holika. Engage in the festivities with devotion, joy, and colorful celebrations.

title: ‘Chhaava’ collection: Vicky Kaushal's film earns over Rs 535 crore
content: ‘Chhaava,’ the historical drama starring Vicky Kaushal, continues to impress at the box office, hitting Rs. 535.55 crore in just 27 days. Directed by Laxman Utekar, the film has received praise for its gripping plot and Kaushal's powerful performance. With Holi festivities approaching, further growth is anticipated despite experiencing slower weekdays.

title: ASI can whitewash Sambhal mosque facade: Allahabad high court
content: Allahabad High Court has ordered the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to whitewash the Sambhal Jama Masjid's outer facade and the mosque committee to cover the expenses within a week. The decision followed a petition by the mosque management committee. The court will reevaluate the situation on April 8, considering further conditions set by the ASI report.

title: Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar not on same page as delimitation row escalates
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah backed Tamil Nadu's campaign against the population-based delimitation, contrasting with his deputy's cautious stance. A Tamil Nadu delegation proposed a joint action committee, aiming to involve multiple states. The protest revolves around accusations of bias against southern states in the delimitation process. Siddaramaiah condemned actions that weaken democracy and federal principles.

title: Retaking of the Jaffar Express: Pak forces kill all ‘terrorists’; 21 hostages slain by BLA
content: Pakistan's military killed all Baloch Liberation Army terrorists and freed 300 hostages in Balochistan. The militant group hijacked the Jaffar Express train. The operation left 21 hostages dead due to militant actions. The train had over 450 passengers including security personnel. The terrorists were in contact with their leaders in Afghanistan.

title: Banke Bihari temple rejects call to ban Muslim-made attire for deity
content: Authorities at Banke Bihari temple in Vrindavan have dismissed a proposal to ban dresses made by Muslim weavers for Lord Krishna, emphasizing the importance of the purity of the attire. They stated that devotees from all backgrounds are welcome to contribute, provided they have faith in Thakurji.

title: 2 scribes held for ‘derogatory content’ against Telangana CM
content: Two woman journalists, Pogadadanda Revathi and Bandi Sandhya, were arrested in Hyderabad for circulating a derogatory video about Telangana CM A Revanth Reddy. The video, involving an elderly farmer, led to a complaint from the Congress’s social media cell. Their arrest sparked criticism from BRS's KT Rama Rao, questioning Congress's stance on free speech.

title: Rs 2,200 crore PF-gratuity fund spent on wages: Maha transport minister
content: Maharashtra's transport minister, Pratap Sarnaik, admitted that employees' provident fund and gratuity were used to cover daily expenses and salary hikes for the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation. The opposition demanded a complaint against the MSRTC's managing director. Sarnaik assured that future improper use of funds would be avoided and employees would not lose interest on diverted money.

title: Telangana government forms independent experts panel to study socio-economic survey data
content: Eleven member Working Group to analyse and interpret the SEEEPC data and submit its report within one month

title: In Rajya Sabha, Trinamool calls for short discussion on duplicate EPICs next week
content: Opposition paused its protest in the Upper House on the issue of duplication of elector photo identity cards (EPIC) and the delimitation exercise for a day

title: Rajasthan CM announces recruitment to 26,000 posts, poverty-free village, and employment schemes
content: Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma targeted the Opposition Congress on several issues, saying its leaders lacked the vision for development and were embroiled in “internal conspiracy”

title: Railways to dig ponds under Mission Amrit Sarovar to fight water scarcity
content: Officials told to desilt existing water bodies or construct new ones at sites close to railway tracks

title: Central officials hold meeting with Kuki-Zo, Meitei groups
content: The movement of commercial vehicles on National Highways Number 2 and Number 37 was blocked by Kuki-Zo protesters for the fourth consecutive day

title: Cab driver helps nab men ‘disposing of’ body in Kolkata
content: The deceased owed a large amount of money to the accused, and was unable to pay it, the police investigation found

title: No spraying colours on pedestrians: Mumbai police issues advisory for Holi celebrations
content: The advisory forbids citizens from sprinkling colours on pedestrians and making obscene utterances in public in order to prevent any incident of communal tension and breach of public peace

title: Muslim MLAs will be thrown out of Bengal Assembly when BJP comes to power, says Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari
content: Members of the Treasury Benches tabled a censure motion against Mr. Adhikari for the remarks he made after the suspension of BJP MLAs

title: Centre refuses to answer Rajya Sabha queries on Great Nicobar project clearances, saying it is sub-judice
content: Trinamool MP Saket Gokhale presses for answer, raises tribal concerns; Congress MP Jairam Ramesh says House is entitled to discuss anything except HC, SC judges’ conduct as per RS Chairman’s 2023 ruling

title: Parliamentary panel asks Centre to spend more on agriculture, rename Ministry
content: ‘Farm labourers, who often belong to marginalised communities, are a critical part of the agricultural workforce but are frequently overlooked in policy discussions and welfare schemes,’ the committee said

title: Congress and BJP members in the Lok Sabha call for unified action to tackle drug menace
content: Congress leader K.C. Venugopal underscored the devastating impact of drug abuse, particularly in his home State of Kerala

title: Nepal royals' ties to Goraksh Peeth behind Yogi poster in Kathmandu
content: Posters of UP CM Yogi Adityanath at a rally in Kathmandu caused a stir, highlighting the historical ties between Nepal's former monarchy and Gorakhsh Peeth. Pradeep Bikram Rana, who waved the poster, claimed persecution by Kathmandu authorities, prompting his escape. The Shah dynasty, which aligns with the Gorakhnath sect, maintains traditional ties with the temple, sending offerings annually.

title: 38% of U-6 kids stunted, 17% underweight: Govt
content: The government's Poshan Tracker data reveals that as of February, 8.8 crore children aged 0-6 years were enrolled in Anganwadis. Out of them, 8.5 crore children were measured on growth parameters. The Ministry highlights a 37.7% stunting rate and 17.1% underweight rate among these children. The government's data shows improvement compared to National Family Health Surveys.

title: Karnataka nixes CID probe into police escort for Ranya Rao
content: The Karnataka government withdrew its approval for a CID probe into the police escort given to actor Ranya Rao at Bengaluru airport. This decision came within 24 hours of the announcement, allegedly due to pressure, and is now handled by senior IAS officer Gaurav Gupta.

title: CBI searches NCLT ex-official’s premises in Rs 1 crore bribery case
content: CBI raided the premises of a retired NCLT official in a bribery case involving a legal firm and an NCLT litigant. The firm allegedly demanded Rs 1.5 crore for a favourable order, later reduced to Rs 1 crore. Rs 20 lakh had been paid before the CBI intervened, registering a case and searching involved parties.

title: With 9 of 10 Haryana mayoral seats, BJP humbles Congress
content: BJP dominated the municipal polls in Haryana, winning nine out of ten mayoral seats. Woman candidates secured seven mayoral positions. CM Nayab Singh Saini hailed the outcome as public endorsement. Congress suffered setbacks, including in Rohtak. Some independent candidates also triumphed, notably in Manesar and Faridabad. BJP claimed 90% of councillor seats.

title: Uttarakhand HC acquits polio-hit man of rape over flawed probe
content: Uttarakhand High Court acquitted a polio-affected man convicted of rape and ordered the state government to compensate him with Rs 5 lakh due to investigation flaws. The man, an employee at a cybercafe, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence. The court cited his physical condition making the charges questionable and found improper police investigation.

title: Tamil Nadu ruined by ganja, corruption, liquor under DMK Government, says Annamalai
content: Addressing BJP state president K. Annamalai was addressing a public meeting held at Puliyangudi on Wednesday.

title: Popularise fortified rice scheme, House panel tells Centre
content: The panel hopes meticulous implementation of the scheme will eradicate malnutrition, improving the overall health and well-being of vulnerable populations

title: J&K L-G remits life imprisonment of three Jammu convicts
content: The authorities instructed the police to monitor their activities and warned that any violation will lead to the “cancellation of their remission”

title: Rajya Sabha debates working of Railways, Opposition slams privatisation of services
content: The Opposition placed a chargesheet against the Centre by citing frequent rail accidents and complaints about poor quality of services offered in trains due to privatisation

title: Design stage of small modular nuclear reactor completed:  Jitendra Singh
content: Once the project is sanctioned, it will take 60-72 months for the reactor to be constructed, Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Jitendra Singh informs Lok Sabha

title: UoH Students’ Union up in arms against Kancha Gachibowli auction
content: The students’ union of the University of Hyderabad gave a call for protest on March 13, 2025 near the proposed auction site with the slogan ‘Bachao Mushroom Rock’

title: IGNCA regional centre opened in Tiruchanur
content: The relics of Agastya Maharishi and his statue were brought from Varanasi and placed in an exhibition named as Agastya Maharishi Exhibition

title: Govt. not against conducting KAS prelims for third time, says Siddaramaiah
content: Candidates have challenged KPSC’s notification on the conduct of main examination before KSAT, which is expected to hear the matter today on Thursday

title: Sub-Registrars cannot register civil suit plaints and make them reflect in property encumbrance certificates, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says permitting such a process would only help trouble mongers to prevent landowners from dealing with their properties

title: Viveka murder case: Approver seeks tight security
content: As few key witnesses in the case have died recently, approver Shaik Dastagiri submits a letter to Kadapa SP requesting to beef up the security

title: Thalangara Thopi on the brink of extinction as last artisan halts production
content: The Thalangara cap was an essential part of Muslim attire, especially during the holy month of Ramzan. However, the demand has tapered off

title: DLSA orders Kalaburagi corporation to complete underground drainage works by March 16
content: It comes in response to a petition filed by social activist Vaijnath Zhalki objecting to the inordinate delay in completing the works

title: Eight youths reported missing from different parts of J&K, say NC, PDP leaders
content: NC MLA tells Assembly of Poonch teenager who went missing after appearing from an exam; others reported missing from Kathua, Devsar, Ganderbal this year; five other missing people found dead in Kathua

title: APSCHE releases schedules of EAPCET, ICET and ECET
content: As per a statement released by the council, A.P. Engineering, Agriculture and Pharmacy (EAPCET)-2025 (Engineering) exams will be held from May 21 to May 27.

title: Riyadh Air CEO in town for talks with Air India, IndiGo
content: India is a really important market; Riyadh Air will offer efficient connections back into India for many, says Tony Douglas

title: Subash Guttedar says ₹35 crore misappropriated under MGNREGA scheme in Aland taluk
content: According to the former MLA, the authorities are digging open wells in several GPs under MGNREGA using machines avoiding workers

title: Uncertainty continues over rehabilitation of Mundakkai-Chooralmala survivors
content: Most survivors are unhappy with the government’s rehabilitation plan; they allege that livelihood loss not considered by govt.

title: In a first, women officers are on Attukal Pongala festival duty tour
content: The female officers have been deployed to ensure fire safety, shift devotees felled by heat exhaustion to hospitals, and provide emergency services within a 10 km radius of the temple

title: Protest over garbage dumping withdrawn on municipal commissioner’s assurance
content: Residents of various localities near Hosayellapur in Dharwad have taken exception to chemical fumes emanating from a landfill

title: Report suggests private mobility solutions to decongest Bengaluru
content: The report also recommends carriage licenses for non-commercial vehicles to promote shared mobility services like bike pooling and carpooling.

title: Thunder clinch playoff spot by passing Celtics test
content: The Thunder clinched a playoff berth Wednesday night in Boston against a Celtics team that has "achieved what we are trying to accomplish."

title: Rodgers a free agent for 1st time as Jets cut QB
content: The Jets officially released Aaron Rodgers on Wednesday, making him a free agent for the first time in his career.

title: Woman who accused Worthy gets protective order
content: Attorneys for Tia Jones confirmed she was granted a protective order against Chiefs receiver Xavier Worthy, adding that she is "fully cooperating with law enforcement as they continue to actively investigate the violence that occurred."

title: Plumlee, Adams ejected after first-half skirmish
content: The Suns' Mason Plumlee and Rockets center Steven Adams were involved in a first-half skirmish that resulted in both players being ejected.

title: Rams release Kupp after failing to trade star WR
content: The Rams have officially released Cooper Kupp after failing to find a trade partner for their star wide receiver.

title: Sources: QB Jones has 2-year deal with 49ers
content: Mac Jones, who wanted an opportunity to work with coach Kyle Shanahan, agreed to terms with the 49ers on a deal worth $7 million with $5 million guaranteed, sources said.

title: WR Williams returning to Chargers on 1-year deal
content: Mike Williams and the Chargers agreed to a one-year deal worth up to $6 million, a source told ESPN's Kris Rhim, confirming a Fox Sports report.

title: Simeone: 'Ball doesn't move' on disallowed pen
content: Diego Simeone questioned the decision to disallow Julián Álvarez's crucial penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League shootout win over Atlético Madrid, insisting "the ball doesn't move" after VAR decided the forward had kicked the ball twice.

title: Men's Bracketology: North Carolina climbs to 'last team in'
content: The Tar Heels improved their NCAA tournament hopes with Wednesday's second-round ACC tournament win over Notre Dame.

title: What happens in Vegas: Oregon State punches ticket, UNLV upset to shake up women's Bracketology
content: Champ Week claimed another conference tournament 1-seed when UNLV was upset. But Oregon State's unlikely path to March Madness won the day.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Knicks slip while the Warriors climb
content: Our NBA insiders analyze this week's Power Rankings and assess the health status of all 30 teams with one month remaining in the regular season.

title: The inevitability of Real Madrid breaking Atléti hearts in the UCL
content: Real Madrid and Atlético couldn't be separated over two legs but, when Wednesday's match went to penalties, there was only ever going to be one outcome.

title: Quarterfinal predictions, from Real Madrid-Arsenal to Villa-PSG
content: The round of 16 is over and after some amazing Champions League action, what will happen in the next round?

title: How Jacob deGrom is learning to throw smarter, not harder
content: DeGrom hasn't pitched a full season since 2019 -- but the Rangers ace has a plan to make 2025 special.

title: How the SEC became the most dominant conference in college basketball
content: Dwarfed by football no more, the SEC's rise as a men's basketball powerhouse didn't happen overnight.

title: Can anyone stop Scottie Scheffler? Who are some sleeper picks? Previewing the Players storylines
content: From Scheffler's attempt at a three-peat to Colin Morikawa's chances to get back in the winner's circle, we have five big topics to keep an eye on this week.

title: NHL playoff projections: Canucks or Flames for the final Western Conference wild card?
content: The two Pacific Division clubs vying for one spot face off Wednesday night in Alberta. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: Awards Watch: New leaders for Hart, Norris as playoff races heat up
content: With about a month left in the regular season, there are new leaders for league MVP and the best defenseman.

title: Maurice Cheeks reunites with Trail Blazers national anthem singer he aided
content: Prior to a 2003 Trail Blazers playoff game, 13-year-old Natalie Gilbert stumbled on her words while performing the national anthem before then-Portland head coach Maurice Cheeks stepped up to help.

title: Why astronaut Suni Williams runs in space: a 14-billion-year odyssey
content: Suni Williams' eight-day mission turned into a nine-month marathon. Now the astronaut is days away from leaving the International Space Station and returning to Earth.

title: Amorim: Players can't argue with Ratcliffe criticism
content: Ruben Amorim has told his Manchester United players that they cannot have any complaints about criticism from co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Swanson to miss NWSL start for personal reasons
content: Chicago Stars FC forward Mallory Swanson will miss the start of the 2025 National Women's Soccer League season due to personal reasons, the club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: USWNT's Rodman: Matter of time to play abroad
content: United States and Washington Spirit forward Trinity Rodman has said it's a matter of time before she plays abroad but added that she remains focused on the upcoming NWSL season that kicks off on Friday.

title: Messi set to return for Inter Miami in Jamaica
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano confirmed Lionel Messi will be traveling with the team to Jamaica to face Cavalier FC in the second leg of the Concacaf Champions Cup round-of-16 series Thursday at Kingston's Independence Park.

title: Barça women finish off Madrid to reach Copa final
content: Barcelona exerted their dominance over Real Madrid once again on Wednesday with a 3-1 Clásico win at the Johan Cruyff Stadium as they booked their place in the final of the Copa de la Reina.

title: Ronaldo withdraws from CBF presidential race
content: Brazil football great Ronaldo said that he was pulling out of the race to be president of his country's football association (CBF) on Wednesday after failing to gather enough support from regional federations to present a candidacy.

title: Man Utd CEO: New stadium poses 'risk' to team
content: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada has admitted the club "risk" falling further behind their rivals while they invest in their new stadium.

title: Slot: Loss to PSG 'best game' I've been part of
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot described the second leg of his team's Champions League tie with Paris Saint-Germain as the "best game of football" he has been involved in.

title: Quakes reign could define ex-USMNT boss Arena's complicated legacy
content: Bruce Arena is the greatest American soccer coach in history, but in a career of highs and lows, his Earthquakes job could cement how he's remembered.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How far does Alex Pereira fall at light heavyweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: PFL FAQ: What big changes are coming this year?
content: Who's fighting in the PFL -- and who's not -- in 2025? Here's everything you need to know about the new format.

title: Kings of command: Breakout pitchers to draft
content: Which overlooked pitchers have the skill set to come up with a big season? Tristan H. Cockcroft digs deep into the numbers to present his annual look at MLB's "Kings of Command."

title: Man United's Europa League fate depends on a misfiring attack finding the net
content: Man United's season hinges on advancing in the Europa League, but thanks to their woefully underperforming attack, it's far from guaranteed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Isak firms as Arsenal's No. 1 target
content: Goal-shy Arsenal reportedly have Newcastle's Alexander Isak at the top of their summer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Australian GP: All you need to know ahead of the first race of 2025
content: Everything you need to know for the 2025 season-opening Australian Grand Prix at Albert Park in Melbourne.

title: Bell returned to the dirt. Now no one in NASCAR can stop him
content: After his team-imposed ban on dirt racing was lifted, Christopher Bell is back enjoying the hobby he loves, and his NASCAR form has never been better.

title: Family ties: Donovan McNabb Jr. receives offer from Michael Vick, Norfolk State
content: Donovan McNabb Jr. could have the opportunity to play for his dad's former Eagles teammate as Norfolk State became the latest school to make an offer to the 2027 wide receiver.

title: 'Bring the doughnuts': Cavs hilariously stuff Jaylon Tyson's vehicle for failing rookie task
content: The forward didn't deliver the team breakfast as asked, so his teammates replied with a rookie prank.

title: WWE 2K25 review: A solid entry that improves on its predecessor
content: The WWE 2K series has shown steady improvement since its soft relaunch with WWE 2K22 -- and WWE 2K25 is no exception.
